reviewText: Great stuff, I sweat by this as it's a much better deal than the name brand packets, plus liquid is a lot more convenient and mixes better. Tastes great too, not at all chemically like the pink and blue stuff, only started to taste a bit off if you use a ton of it (like 20+ drops)- or taste it directly from the container which I did... But 2-3 drops is plenty to make a cup of coffee really sweet (I normally use 5 of the yellow packets of powered fake sugar). This is my sweetener for life, i will not be going back to the more expensive stuff that never seems to last. Get this, it really is great!
summary: Better than the yellow packets of name brand sweetener!

reviewText: This bag of candy was a big hit for Halloween. Everything came fresh and packaged very well. We would order it again.

I'm very sporadic with my graham cracker intake.  Usually the box finds itself being used as the crust for a pie or cheesecake.  But these, since they were a special flavor I decided to eat (although they bake just as well).For eating, these made a really good breakfast.  I was surprised that you could actually taste the apple in these graham crackers.  Usually in apple cinnamon flavored products, you can taste the cinnamon but not the apple, so this was nice.  It was also visually appealing because you could see the little oats right on top of the graham cracker.  I didn't really taste them though, but I sure felt healthy eating it!  Another great aspect of these crackers were that they were made with whole grains.  I normally eat whole grains and am used to the flavor, but I didn't notice much difference in taste between these and regular non-whole grain crackers.  These graham crackers weren't really addicting though (which could be good or bad depending on the person) and they weren't the first thing I would choose to eat if headed for a snack.  They were good, but not something so excellent that I would look forward to them.Ingredients: Graham flour (whole grain wheat), Whole Grain Rolled Oats, Evaporated Cane Juice, Safflower Oil, Honey, Sugar, Brown Rice Syrup, Apple Juice Concentrate, Raisin Paste, Leavening, Sea Salt, Cinnamon, Vitamin E, and natural flavor.  This is surprisingly nice in a world with HFCS and other artificial flavors and preservatives seem to rule.On a different aspect, Back to Nature seems to be a good company to buy from.  They are a support of Nature Conservancy and the boxes for these crackers were made of 100% recycled paperboard.  I would probably use these graham crackers again, or check out some regularly flavored kind by the same company.Review by M. Reynard 2011
however its cousin red rooibos is more potent and sometimes lasts a few cups. this one is less potent, so you really have to hold the bag in a cup for 3-5 min.

Healthy does not have to be yuchy. This product is healthy and does not contain any of the usual offensive additives. The product satisfies the crunch drive and is filling. I particularly liked it becasue it is not too sweet but is still satisfying. Just a great snack to have around!

I am researching the best protein powders and super foods and picked a pouch of this Amazing Meal Vanilla Chai at my whole foods and it was amazingly delicious in my smoothie. I also added hemp seeds and it was the first time I was tasting hemp seeds so not sure if that had a LOT to do with it but I could taste vanilla chai and I don't even *like* vanilla but I loved this. Thinking about getting a bigger container but I was hoping for a little more protein than just 10 grams per serving. Oh well. It's still pretty yummy! And from my research so far, the price is JUST right!
summary: Delicious and easy to digest and excellent price

reviewText: I am usually not big into ramen noodles, especially the one's with extra veggies or sides. I always get the chicken and nothing else. I decided to try this one because of the Chef's Best stamp. I tried this and i must say it wasn't bad at all. I didn't realize it would have real chicken bits in it, carrot, and other veggies. The taste was good, i did add a little tony's seasoning salt (that's just me i add it to almost everything). Overall i was surprised, but in a good way. It was quick, the directions simple and easy, was a huge serving, i couldn't finish it all, and was just as good as the ramen noodles chicken that i usually eat, if not better.

I, like several others, received a complementary jar in order to provide my opinion.  I will start by saying to those not familiar with this type oil, it could be a solid or liquid depending on the ambient temperature.  When it arrived, I was not aware of this and tilted the jar when opening and dumped some out on the counter.  After a few days, it solidified.I have used it for cooking and it provides a great alternative to butter or other types of oils.  I especially like the subtle flavor and aroma it adds.  Where I think it shines is in applications where you need to "grease the pan", the consistency allows you to use this healthy oil as a substitute to butter or shortening.While I do like the product, I don't find myself using it as often as olive oil for my day in and day out uses, but that does not reflect on its quality.  Its just what I'm used to, but I will definitely be using this more often when baking.
summary: Great substitute for butter or shortening

reviewText: This buckwheat cereal is very good.  This one tastes nutty.  I fix it like most other grains then add walnuts, cinnamon and a small amount of sweetner (like xylitol).  You can't go wrong with Bob's Red Mill.
summary: Yet another whole grain worth eating

reviewText: Love the great chocolate taste.  I put it in the fridge so it's cold.  Not sure it's worth the price over chocolate milk.  It's made for the taking right after a work out and I haven't noticed a difference.  I gave it four stars for the taste.
summary: tastes great not sure I need this over chocolate milk

reviewText: I tried both the brown rice (this one) and the white rice versions of this product. While both suffer from a high degree of saltiness, the white rice version had a much better texture that more closely resembled wheat-based pasta. This version was rather gummy. Not so gummy that it was inedible, but certainly not something I'd want to have again.As with the rice version, preparation is very easy - just add water and microwave it for 3.5 minutes. The serving size is small - this is best as a snack or a side dish rather than the main course.The white rice version is passable; this is far less appealing. Not recommended.
summary: Not very appealing texture; white rice version is better

reviewText: If you use onion powder in cooking a lot, you must be tired of buying a regular sized onion powder. Save a container, and buy this greatly priced high quality onion powder. You save the earth with recycling the container rather than throwing away each time, and save money at the same time! The powder is very smooth, no clumping whatsoever! Wonderful aroma too!
summary: Great smooth onion powder for the price!

reviewText: I read the reviews before trying PB2 peanut butter powder and even with all of the good feedback, I was skeptical. As it turns out, it's surprising and delicious. Getting another jar today. I prepared it exactly as instructed on the jar (2 TBS PB2 powder + 1 TBS water) and it was amazing - more like natural PB without all of the oil and less sweetness than store brands. They add just the right amount of sugar to this product. The total ingredients are peanuts, salt and sugar. 45 cals for 2 TBS. Also, I tried this in Greek yogurt (1 TBS to one container of yogurt) and it was really good and peanuty! You have to try it to believe it. I'm going to try the chocolate version next. I'd like to make a sesame noodle with this and maybe mini donuts or smoothies. I plan to experiment. A LOT.I'll be buying a few for stocking stuffers, too. Great product!
summary: Very very good, try it - you'll like it!

reviewText: I purchased the variety pack because I wanted see which one I liked best.  I love all of them.  The black pepper one was the last one I tried.  I really like it just as well as the other ones.  Some of them are spicy hot but soo good. They look like a potato chip but not greasy.  Once you start eating them you can't put them down.  There is 100 calories in each bag and each bag is .8 oz's.  You have to try them, glad I did!  I gave them 5 stars because they are so very good.

Ok, so I am a little biased. I adore the late Paul Newman, his family, his enterprise, his charity, and all of his products. But I also love me some dark chocolate! I take my chocolate tasting very seriously and wouldn't give it high marks just based on sheer good will. This is some seriously good stuff! Even though I love dark chocolate, I am not what one would call a chocoholic. I have restraint. I typically have a bar in my cupboard, then after dinner break off a piece or two. I savor it, then I leave it at that. Tonight I tried a piece of this delicious confection had to eat half the bar all at once. It was SO GOOD! What I love about it is it's creamy consistency. You usually find that in only milk chocolate, whereas dark chocolate usually has a sharp, almost bitter taste to it. You don't get any of that bitter taste in this bar at all - and yet it's a true dark chocolate. How do they do that? There are lots of subtle undertones of flavors, and it makes for an amazing dessert. And of course coming from Paul Newman, it's heaven sent.Bonus too that they took such great care in choosing the best fair-trade organic chocolate. That's a big deal because if you look at most commercial chocolate sources, it makes the diamond industry look tame. This makes Newman's Organic a truly guilt-free delight. Enjoy!
summary: Possibly the best dark chocolate ever

reviewText: I love these because it is just bananas.  No sugar or preservatives.  A good healthy snack for anyone.  However, I don't eat bananas.  I actually got them for my chinchillas.  I like to buy them healthy treats and these are the best for them.  They store well, they are not sticky or sweet and my chinchillas love them!  Skip the sugary pet store crap and buy these.  They're great!

This granola is great to bake with, or eat out of the bag. I haven't tried it with cold milk yet. It is quite good hot though. There is a slight blueberry taste to it, nothing strong. These make great gifts as well. I've gifted out a couple bags already. The price is unbeatable, plus the shipping time is prompt. They come to you packaged in a nice box. The granola itself is not too sweet, has a hint of vanilla flavor & slight blueberry. It is very good & this is a great place to order, especially the subscribe & save that delivers on schedule or earlier if you run low. I'm trying all the other flavors too, but this one is my favorite. Everyone I have given a bag to is hooked on it.

reviewerName: Lover of Books, Food & Good Deals
reviewText: This cookie will fit the bill for many on restrictive diets. The only grains in it are sorghum and rice, and it contains no dairy, eggs, or nuts either. They're soft, chewy, sweet, and if your craving is for an oatmeal cookie, it will fill the bill! It falls one star short of five because it does unfortunately contain processed sugar, and occasionally the currents seem very hard.

This basket is a lovely all-purpose gift or splurge for yourself. It arrived with a nice brown (grosgrain?)ribbon and a red sticker from the company...a welcome change from the over the top huge satiny ribbons on some baskets. Inside, high-end as well as homey treats including hoity-toity truffles and down-to-earth Sunmaid chocolate raisins. Something for everyone!
summary: My faith is restored in ig4U

reviewerName: Glenda Boozer "Live, live, live! Life is a ba...
reviewText: When I first poured a bowl of this, I got distracted for a few minutes and came back to it expecting to find soggy flakes, but the crunch was still there! Freeze-dried berries retained all the flavor of fresh ones, and I could taste the brown sugar and whole grains in the flakes. This was a wake-up call for my morning taste buds.
summary: Vibrant berry flavors, crunchy whole-grain flakes

reviewText: My son loves the Andy Capp hot fries but they are way too hot for me.  I like these. They have such a good flavor and texture. Warning: they are addictive!
If you love Kit Kat bars, then this is a fine way to buy them and have enough around for a party or for that candy jar that you won't overuse that 1st day...discipline yourself.

I've used this pasta in my Italian dishes.  I've used it in my chicken vegetable soup.  It tastes great in everything.  It's also hearty so you feel satisfied when you eat it.  Don't be turned off because it has all those good things added to it to make it healthier.  It tastes just like your regular pasta.  In fact, I think it tastes better than white flour pasta.
These seeds are what I expected when I ordered them.  They are fresh, I didn't find any hulls. They taste good. The package arrived intact and on schedule.  I'll order them again.

Could have more of a vanilla punch but it is very good for a sugar free syrup.  This is meant for flavoring drinks such as coffee, not as a pancake syrup, if you are not familiar with the brand.  It has no thickening.  I mostly used it for coffee, but also tried it out for a "milk shake" - 1 cup milk, 2 TBSP Torani Sugar Free Vanilla Syrup, 5 ice cubes.  Puree in blender until smooth.Sweetened with sucralose.

I'm a health-bar enthusiast.  Sometimes 3 or 4 a day.  When you're into health-bars that deeply you get to taste a lot of cardboard.  Or worse.  Not with this Odwalla Banana Nut.  Actually, I've tried several Odwalla bars and they all exceed the taste test, elevate the energy expectations, taste exactly like they're promoted, and are seriously underpriced.  Other manufacturers of so-called health-bars could take a lesson from Odwalla and in so doing help improve the performance and health of the public smart enough to eat sensibly.  Good product, buy some and try it yourself.  You'll be glad you did.

The hot cereal is tasty and easy to prepare - I have only tried it with a bit of smart balance with olive oil, so far.  I like that it is organic and has flax and it will be awesome to use for baking.  I love the texture, but for some things I may grind it finer.  I got the 4 grain + flax because I can always add soy, corn, millet, etc.. for a change of pace. The quality is excellent and the price was right - a little over $3 a box or .13 cents an ounce!  The serving size is 1/4 cup dry, cooked with 3/4 cup water and it is a good size portion, I was really surprised.  Some of the other multigrain hot cereals have serving sizes of 1/2 cup dry with similar calories, etc... as the Arrowhead Mills, so they are really a lot more expensive per serving, even though they are close to this in price per ounce.  I am on a fixed income, so I compare a lot to get the lowest prices.  I do wish it had a bag with a zip or something on the inside, but will reuse an oatmeal cannister or something. :) It arrived a day earlier than expected, which was a pleasant surprise.

I give this 3 stars because it wasn't unpleasant coffee.  It just didn't taste like anything.  It reminded me of hot water with those Folgers coffee bags dunked in it for a little bit.  I don't like too strong a coffee but this was way underpowered for coffee.  I enjoy the bolder coffees, too, such as Coffee People Organic Bold and Dark Magic.  I would not buy Nantucket again.

These fell short on flavor, sweetness, and satisfaction. As other reviewers have mentioned, they do have a bit of an after taste too.  Trader Joe's are way better and at a much better price.For those that absolutely want less calories and low sugar they would get you by, but for me, I'd rather have a little less of something really good.
summary: Sorry, I didn't agree with y'all

reviewText: This xanthan gum works well in my gluten free recipes. I recommend storing in an airtight container in the refrigerator for the best shelf life.Also, if you happen to have a spill, use a dry paper towel or hand vac to get up as much as you can before getting it wet, because once moisture is added, it can get sticky and messy.I've used this in dozens of gluten free baking recipes, and as long as I measure carefully and don't add too much, this really gives them the body and structure they need.

Summer has arrived, and with it shorts, beach attire etc. I thought this tea might be good to sip between meals to help drop a few lbs. Well, it might work since sipping this doesn't encourage me to want more. I tried steeping longer as suggested, all I got was bitter cold tea instead of hot bland tea. Most were too weak, although the tomato mint was very minty. The only two I liked and finished were the spincach and the fennel. I love fennel and I could catch the faint licorice taste in the fennel tea.I think I'd better off sipping broth, because the faint taste of broth in the tea just left me wanting something with real mouth flavor. Not a fan

This is a very tasty cereal, but I find it a bit too sweet for my liking. The Os look similar toHoney Nut Cheerios, but they taste more likeCap'n Crunch Peanut Butter Crunch. In terms of sugar content Crunchy Nut is comparable to Honey Nut Cheerios (about 10 g each) so if you like that amount of sugar in your cereal then the choice between these two will come down to taste. The little pieces of nuts that are embedded in each O are hardly noticeable, both visually and in terms of the overall taste. It turns out that these are technically speaking not really nuts, but rather peanuts. They mostly have an effect in terms of the overall flavor - the combination of corn/oats and peanut pieces is probably responsible for the peanut-buttery taste. The Os are indeed very crunchy, and they are among the crunchiest cereals that I have ever tried. They don't lose this crunchiness easily even after a minute or two of soaking in milk. Crunchy Nut Os also make a very tasty and convenient snack. I have also tried them with blueberries and the fruity flavor comes as a nice contrast to all the sugariness of this cereal. Overall, this is a very nice cereal but it's nothing spectacular.

I call it the "4 P's of Vegetarianism" (Protein Price Per Pound) and if you have to mail order most of your veg protein products like I do, the Linketts 6 lb can is about the best it gets short of making your own.  If you order this through Amazon's Subscribe and Save program, it's an even better deal.  I have done the research, having been a vegetarian living in remote "veg head un-friendly" towns for most of my adult life.  Tip: open and drain these links and package well in freezer bags and they freeze up nicely.

I like my food hot - the hotter the better.  I like to add a variety of sauces to various dishes to change them/spice them up.  One meal I make a lot is bland in and of itself so it is the sauce that lends interest to it.  I primarily got this sauce to use when eating that dish.  Its name suggests it is "bold and creamy" and I'll let them have that.  It is a reddish colored, creamy sauce that does have a very good flavor and just a hint of heat.  It makes my food enjoyable to eat.  For 5 stars I'd want it butt-burner hot, though I do recognize that they are trying to cater to the food tastes of the majority and a sauce like that would be purchased by a minority.
summary: Creamy sauce with a hint of spicy-ness

reviewText: I was very pleased with this product. A large container, should last a long time. I only with the pour spout was designed just a little better, I always have a drip ... but a minor issue with an otherwise fabulous product.Update: I have since learned that if you hold the can just a second longer after your pour, it will not drip. yeah!

i have just bought this product to try because it was cheeper then the  othere product i had bought before. so rite now i am makeing coconut yogurt with the othere starter i just called the company in cal. to ask them about making coconut yogurt as mine is still waterie. we will see on this.
summary: Yogourmet Freeze-Dried Kefir Starter Set 6 Packet(s)

reviewText: I use it quite often,it comes in different flavors and I find them quite refreshing-I loveall the flavorsTry them,their great to meAmber087
This is one vegemite item that is good. There are also quite a few recipes out there for using these that you can google. Have purchased these for years!

Well, I am not into energy drinks, mostly because the thought of 'taurine' disgusts me.  But this one uses caffeine and sugar, both natural things I eat anyway (it claims to have the same caffeine as a cup of coffee, sugar from apple juice).  The taste was okay, I have never tried the other flavors so I did not have those to compare to, it was too sour/crisp/tart apple for me.  I did not notice any difference in my energy level, I have been suffering from mild sporadic insomnia the last year or so so anything to help boost me on those days afterwards is nice, but I did not notice any real boost from this.
summary: not bad, but just not my thing

reviewText: I eat my cereal with soymilk and I eat it any time of the day when I need a quick meal.  I am a cereal lover.  However, I am not impressed this Quaker Oatmeal Squares Oatmeal cereal.  It doesn't have the favors of grains I expect in a cereal.  Instead, it tastes like sweetened graham crackers, which I don't care for on the first place. The only good things I can say is that the cereal stays crunchy in soymilk and its small size fits the spoon well.  The manufacturer Quaker claims that the fiber in it will lower my cholesterol, but many cereals makers make that claim these days. This cereal is not for me.
This is a very useful product. Good for high temp cooking, while it is also an excellent skin softener, and hair conditioner. Not bad fats! Good fats!
Wanted to eat this instead of chips or other unhealthy things a night. Usually eat for supper & it does me fine, where I don't want any snacksbefore bedtime.
This coffee is nice, full bodied, and smooth.. Donut Shop Coffee's are never a disappointing..  You can never go wrong.

I've always had better luck with Red Star than any other yeast for machine bread baking.  And buying a two pound package is a lot cheaper than the store bought 4 oz. jars.I knocked off a star only because of the price here.  As another reviewer said, Smart and Final has this for about $5 (but I think him/her rating it at one star for that alone is excessive).  Some people don't have a Smart and Final close by, and if that were me, I wouldn't hesitate to order this.
summary: Good stuff, just get it locally to save money

reviewText: Honey Bunches of Oats with Almonds, makes the morning here in Afghanistan a traditional breakfast treat. Thank you for the prompt shipping to my location. Supporting the warfighter, and keeping the peace.

I used to buy this all the time when we lived overseas.  It's hard to find in the USA.  It is full milk powder and mixes up to make a really nice, creamy glass of milk, or use it in making hot chocolate!I used it for baking and keep it in the refrigerator.  Non fat is so tasteless.  This really makes breads and cakes extra tasty.
summary: CREAMY Whole Milk Powder, Great for Baking

reviewText: Excellent texture and taste. Good value, too. Buy on Subscribe and Save and you don't have to worry about running out.
Item was exactly as described. This is the best price I could find for the Sriracha peas. I really like the tins they came in too.

Love to pop one of these in my mouth after dinner; takes the need for dessert out of my system and a lot less calories!  The pops are tasty sweet without the artificial sweeteners.  Definitely a good buy.

In a world full of energy drinks, red bull and others, plus coffee and other stimulants to wake you up this product seems like it would have a market...however....I tried it and had others try it as well.... so here are the good things and the bad things:The good:- These are more like lozenges so if you are sick or feeling under the weather they might help.- I like the fact that it has vitamins.- Not much more....The bad:- Bad taste...i am not a big honey flavor kind of person but even other people disliked  the flavor.- No energy boost- Even with vitamins I would prefer to take a supplement instead of these.- Did not like and did not do what was expected....sad but true but hard to compete with all the hardcore "energy" products out in the market.

I'll start this review by saying that this is the first pu'erh tea I have ever tried. I understand that pu'erh tea traditionally comes in a much different brick-like form, not in a teabag. I don't doubt that this tea tastes much different than the traditional pu'erh. I have never tasted that, however, so I cannot really compare this variety to the traditional version.That said, I think this is a very tasty tea. I brewed a pot to share with my wife and a friend of ours. All three of us enjoyed it. The tea itself had a noticeable but not overpowering flavor, and the cardamom spice was a nice complement to the tea flavor. I recommend this tea.

I love cappucino, at home or at my local coffee house, so I hoped that this illy issimo cappuncino coffee drink would be a good substitute.  Alas, it was not to be.Here's my take on this cappucino drink:PROS:1.  Convenience -- With these cans at home or at the office, you can heat up a full cup of cappucino in a minute in the microwave. No dragging out the cappucino maker or running out to get a cappucino.2.  Foam -- After heating, you will see a small amount of foam on the top of the coffee.3.  Low-Cal -- Only 100 calories in this cappucino,and therein lies my problem.CONS:1.  Taste -- Even though I love cappucino, I don't have it often.  When I do give in to the urge, I want it rich with two packs of raw sugar, whole milk, and a generous dash of cinnamon on the foam.  Heavenly.  But this cappucino just doesn't measure up to my idea of what cappucino should be.2.  Off Flavor -- There's an odd taste of tin in my cup.  Maybe it's the cinnamon, maybe it's the can -- I can't say, but I can say that the flavor is tinged with an odd tinny taste.OVERALL:If you're not picky about cappucino, this could be your drink.  I'll wait and get mine just the way I like it at my local coffee house.
summary: No Worries for Your Local Coffee House

reviewText: i like illy in general and this makes a very drink.  a little bit more bitter than illy cappuccino and just the right size.

This is a my new fave seasoning.  I've always just used plain paprika in recipes calling for smoked paprika because I couldn't find it in the markets. Wow what I've been missing!  I'm so glad I finally found it on Amazon.  It imparts a great smokey flavor that makes the simplest dish extra tasty.  Just try smokey paprika on  simple fried potatoes. Excellent!  I'm still experimenting with it and  I haven't been disappointed yet, with anything I've added it to.

These "Pure Bars" are essentially date bars with excessive marketing. Dates are the first ingredient on the list, and they are what are holding together everything else.  This bar is mostly mashed up dates gluing together a collection of fruits, nuts and oats. They aren't bad, but nor are they particularly wonderful.  They are pretty much standard issue for this type of snack.The bars are super dense, not as chewy as a Powerbar, but still give your teeth a workout biting off a chunk.  I had the opportunity to try the Wild Blueberry bar as well, and with both bars it is difficult to distinguish the featured flavor.I passed a few pieces of this "Cherry Cashew" bar around to some friends in a blind taste test, and none of them was able to guess that the intended flavor was cherry.  The overwhelming response was "dates" along with "fruitcake."  Honestly, after eating both the blueberry and the cherry, there wasn't a considerable difference in flavor.Which isn't so bad.  I happen to like fruitcake, and so the bar was good enough that I was happy to eat it.  If you are looking for a healthy snack, this is probably as good as the rest. I thought it was tasty, and would eat them if available. But it is nothing amazing.

According to certain specialist, dark chocolate is better and healthier. As I mentioned, in another review, keep your limit to four because of he sugar alcohol effects on your body. The taste is great.  I do not have to worry about my cravings for regular chocolate with this product.

this is the only mustard for me. i wait until i see a price on it that i like and i grab a 6 pack of it. it tastes so delicious on anything. i have tried other mustards but i gave them away because they don't taste good like this one does. my order shipped with no damage and i am real happy with my order of plochmans mustard. this is my 3rd time ordering this mustard. it's great!
This is a nice light bodied coffee that has little after taste. When we are in the mood for a stronger hazelnut we use green mountain bold hazelnut. This gloria's is a nice every day kind of coffee.

These taste pretty much like any other pretzels, except they're gluten-free. I can't say they are some great health food. My boyfriend has a gluten intolerance and when he first went gluten free he would have totally eaten something like this but now with the main ingredient being corn starch I don't think he would eat them. These also come in sticks and I think these are the better choice of the two both because the ingredients are slightly better on these AND because they don't have the slight aftertaste of the sticks. If you're gluten free and don't want to feel left out when everyone else is crunching on pretzels, then I guess these are for you, but I think it's important to be aware when you are removing something from your diet (like gluten) and end up consuming far more of something else because of that (like corn starch.) You may just be creating a new kind of imbalance. The bag is 8 servings, so if you remember that, it's probably no big deal, but if you belong to the school of thought that one bag = one serving, you may want to have a bag of celery sticks instead.

The Kashi Banana Chocolate Chip bars are great for the health nut who's crazy about the banana and chocolate combination. Great flavor, low in calories (compared to a regular granola bar) and fits well with the Kashi line. These tasted great and were soft instead of crunchy. Just plain old yummy goodness!
Hard to say exactly why but there just not very good in my opinion. Nothing to right home about as the saying goes.
The taste was superb. They aren't too dry. Some nutrition type bars can be dry.

I was looking for a good sugar substitute that does not have side affects.  After reading about this product it seemed a good choice for least known side affects.  This may be true, but for me it has a really strange almost nasty taste.  The plus is, if you can stand the taste you will use about 1/3 as much as you use with Truvia.  I only use a sweetner in coffee, so maybe it will be o.k. in something else.

Like Izze, the basic idea here is soda made with actual fruit juice. No sugar, no HFCS, no preservatives, no coloring; just 100% fruit juice concentrate and sparkling water. Fruits listed are apple, grape, tangerine, orange and acerola (whatever that is).Intriguingly, the can mentions "contains soy" at the end of the ingredients list. There's no protein content listed, so it must be a trace amount. Something to bear in mind if you have a soy allergy, however.Flavor is fantastic. I'd have a hard time choosing between it and Izze, but I think I might just give Switch the edge.
This food is loved by my triplets.  It is very easy to take with us when we go out on road trips.

Great coffee at great price.  I chose it because of price and because of not adding to footprint of earth and was glad I did.  I am very happy with my purchase.  I also get fog chaser from this company and love that too!  I recommend it!

This is the fourth time I've ordered this oatmeal so it's safe to say I'm a big fan. The berry blend is my favorite so far. Low sugar, low sodium, plump berries and hearty oatmeal. Can't go wrong, right? As a nurse working 12 hour shifts these are great to take to work and pop in the microwave. I add a little more water than they suggest because I don't like my oatmeal too thick. There's extra room in the cup so there's no "boil over" and also if you want to add anything. Sometimes I add a few walnuts to bump up the nutritional value. Great product!!

Peanut lovers rejoice!  This is one chewy, nutty, delicious treat.  It's bigger than those granola/power/protein bars and loaded with peanuts on top of a peanut buttery/yogurty base that's sweet but not too sweet.  This yummy snack is a good source of protein - and fat.  At 220 calories, it's not for the dieter, but is tasty and satisfying.  Highly recommended.
Flavorful, high quality specialized product.  A bit pricey though.  My wife uses these to flavor snacks and other foods.  She raves about the taste and nutritional value.
Tasty buy VERY small.  Two or three bites each.  Nice blend of tastes though.  Like I said it's tasty but small.
Some herbal teas are not strong enough, this is just right. It is good for morning or evening. No caffeine.

We have been buying this creamey peanut butter at Walmarts for about 2 years now.  When I found it on Amazon,  I decided it was cheaper to buy it from them than to drive to Walmarts to pay a little more for it.It is smooth and creamy and spreads really well.  I am a spoon dipper and it is so good!

As with any food/beverage product, it is difficult to write an appropriate review since our taste and preference will often vary over a rather wide range.  Also the words a writer chooses to describe a taste might not have the same meaning to the reader and that could lead to disappointment with the review or the product.This Numi tea is a bold, slightly spicy tea. I was a little reluctant to try it since it was described as "peppery" but the spiciness isn't overbearing at all - and I typically drink green teas, which are very mild in flavor, although I occasionally enjoy a cup of strong black tea. This tea should be great for fans of full-bodied teas.I also appreciate that the tea bags are individually wrapped to maintain freshness in every bag even after the package is opened. (It also makes it easy to carry a bag or two along when traveling, or to give a sample to a friend.)I can't really comment on the health claims associated with the tea, since I feel certain you need to consume more than one box to see any change.  If you are going to drink this tea for the health benefits, you will probably need to drink it consistently for an extended period of time.  Also keep in mind that because of the placebo effect, the results you get will often be the results you expect.If you like bold teas or just like to experiment with different taste/flavors, this should be one to give a try.

My last cup of morning coffee is always a medium flavored coffee.  I gravitate towards this Gloria Jeans cappuccino &Emeril's Vanilla Bean Bam!, Medium, K-cups for Keurig Brewers, 24-Count Boxes (Pack of 2).This cappuccino flavored coffee is a nice smooth blend with a hint of cinnamon that works well with a spot of milk.  It smells wonderful when brewed and makes everyone in our office want a cup of their own.
summary: Medium Smooth Flavored Coffee with a Hint of Cinnamon - Not Frothy

reviewText: Pocky is one of the best snack items, it is hard to get myself to stop eating them. Product was not damaged or melted and was delivered as expected.
I love having this in my pantry.  I cook a batch of rice, add some sauce and dinner is served.  My 10-year-old son loves it and asks for it several times a week.

I think my title sums it up. This is far from the best tea, and I routinely drink better tea. Deference is that tea cost more, were as this tea taste just fine and is cheap. Ever day when I show up to work I make a glass of this tea. Fancy teas are nice, but this one gets me through my daily grind.
summary: Not the best black tea, but the best value.

reviewText: I wish I can give this a 0 star. I'm a tea lover who drinks tea everyday and this tea is by far the worst tea I have ever had. I thought I would give it a try to something new. Bummer! I brewed one and the smell reminded me of nasty cold syrup medicine. I could not stand the weird smell at all. Now I'm left with 19 teabags. It will probably just be stuck in my cabinet or I will throw it away.

I was like one other person that had reviewed this item, a bit confused? I have received 4 large gravy containers by McCormick . . .but confused on how to make the gravy?? To the person who gave the review that says there is no instructions, there is??? I called the 800 hot line to McCormick Company and while I was on the phone I was told to look on the side of the container where there is (Nutrition Facts) label . .. . .. you know the label that states what is in the product like the precentage of fats and sodium! On the bottom left side corner of the nutrition label you will see an arrow facing upward!! Peel that label off very gently where you see the arrow and when you peel that off underneath it there is a second label under it giving you cooking and usage instructions! Who would have known!! Good thing I made a phone call today!!!!!  ..  . .I hope I have helped you out to be able to use this product, the same thing applies to all the Mccormick large gravy mixes! Just remove the side label and there will be a second label underneath that one giving cooking instructions!! Good Luck and enjoy making gravy its an awesome product!!
Great coconut product! This is the brand I always buy and you can't beat the price!

Thank you Tinkyada for providing a great GF pasta. This pasta truly is better than regular spaghetti. When my daughters have friends over we make this and they always eat all of it and say it is much better than what they make at their own homes.

Sometimes eating gluten free means lowering your standards of taste when it comes to boxed products. Annie's regular gluten free macaroni is okay, so I thought I would go one step up and try the delux. I think the main difference is the amount of cheese, otherwise the taste is the same to mean, however Annie's is still one of the better boxed mac n cheese brands on the gluten free market.

Yummy!  I really like the ICE spring water/juice products.  Every flavor I've purchased has been delicious.  Instead of carbonated soda I now drink a concoction I make of Arizona sugar-free green tea (Arizona's green tea mix -- also available at Amazon at an excellent price) mixed with a little OJ and another fruit juice.  The "other" juice I've been adding is any flavor of Spring Water ICE I have on hand.  Recently, I bought the 15 pack of the Black Rasberry 33.8 ounce bottles and it was a terrific buy at Amazon.  I would purchase this flavor and any other flavors of ICE again at Amazon without hesitation.

We love Bakery on Main gluten free products. Can't wait to try more of there products. I do wish it was sold in most stores though. I have to drive a good distance to get it, but it is worth the drive.

These are excellent little cookies that are almost like candies in many ways (think Twix or Kit-Kat).Each variety does have a different flavor and texture etc.; however honestly the overall effect of most of them is pretty similar.  Not a bad thing necessarily but just so you know.I got a seemingly giant, rectangular, pretty red tin with two trays filled with a lot of cookies (each tray has the same assortment).  There are two types of cookies that are predominantly white chocolate, with a third which is half-white and half-regular.  Then the rest are either dark or milk chocolate.  The cookies are what I would say is normal sized (i.e., for most people that would be two to four bites per cookie).  Inside the tin's lid is a chart describing each type and pointing out which ones have nuts, etc.These cookies seem to melt easily.  I took a chance on the end of the winter season in Florida, and they arrived sort of stuck together in their compartments, but generally I was able to break them apart.  Still I noticed that at room temperature they did get a little soft, such that they will easily leave chocolate on your fingers.  I just kept them in the refrigerator to get around that problem.I would say there are about 5-6 cookies of each type in its own compartment in the tray; so with two trays you are getting roughly a dozen of each type.  Some are much bigger than others, or thicker, so you get only 4 of that type.  But, it's a lot of cookies.I'm not really a tin collector, but I thought this really sturdy, pretty red tin was an added-value perk of this product.  It's a useful size for a lot of things and isn't covered with hokey illustrations like a lot of tins are.  Mine had a subtle textural patterning; unsure if they are all the same, as the photo on Amazon appears to show a tin that is shaped differently than the one I received.I would probably order these only occasionally, and during the cooler winter season, because they are so rich.  By the time we got to the end of the box, I experienced a sort of burn-out with them.
summary: Good although in truth pretty repetitive in flavors

reviewText: I have bought tuna based on price in the past, usually ending up with Starkist or Chicken of the Sea. I figured tuna was tuna.Well, after trying this Bumble Bee yellow fin tuna, I think my buying habits are changed. This is great tuna. Packed in water, light tasting but with a clean, bright tuna flavor. I used it to make tuna salad sandwiches and was impressed.First of all, there isn't an inordinate amount of water in the can - just enough to keep the tuna moist. Second, the tuna comes out in big chunks that are easy to flake, not the pureed tuna pieces I'm used to with other brands.The only drawback is the $5+ per can price. I definitely like the tuna but do I like it that much more than cheaper brands? Since I don't have tuna that often, I will change over. I did look in the local Safeway and they didn't have this specific tuna (they had the albacore pack rather than yellow fin). I'm going to talk with the store manager and see if they'd order in the yellow fin at hopefully a lesser price.

I HAD PURCHASED THIS WITHOUT KNOWING ANYTHING ABOUT IT AND YOU REALLY SOLD ME.  I ENDED UP BUYING MORE LOCALLY AND THERE IS MORE CHICKEN THAN INDICATED.  IN FACT I GOOFED UP USING WRONG PAN SIZE AND HAD TO POUR INTO SMALLER PAN AND IT STILL COOKED UP GREAT!

I planned to give this product 5 stars because the Kamut (heirloom) wheat is so delicious. There was something in the 2nd bag of this cereal, however. It looked like an organically (randomly) shaped, 1" x 2" piece of milk chocolate... Obviously, I don't know what it was but I know it didn't belong in the cereal bag. There was no smell and the bag didn't appear dirty but I'm a real stickler for Quality Control. I threw away the entire case.Clean up your act Nature's Path. It may take a decade for me to try another one of your products. What a waste for (what I'm assuming is) an otherwise thoughtful and reputable company.
summary: Buyer Be Wary… Look Before You Eat!

reviewText: And a great price on Amazon. I've served this to guests and they always ask what kind it is. Highly recommend for its bold flavor!

I don't know what problem the one star reviewers are talking about. We ordered this on a subscribe and save delivery until they stopped being involved in that program. We never had a problem with all kernels popping, but we pop the traditional method with a cast aluminum pan and oil, olive oil in our case. It must have something to do with the air popping apparatus rather than the popcorn. We selected another brand until they also ceased the subscribe and save feature, and now we are back to Arrowhead.

I received a box with a package of these tasty Oreos - they are chocolate-like coated, with a peanut butter creme filling, and the usual Oreo cookie for the bottom. When I pulled the package of Oreos out of the box, it looked strange. Unfortunately through delivery, sitting in a hot UPS truck/ other, these things melt and change position in their little plastic slots. I immediately put the Oreos in the refrigerator, just on a hunch. It's not even hot yet here in South Texas, it was maybe 80 degrees yesterday. After these cookies had been in the fridge for a few hours, I pulled back the front of the package and saw what happened to my treats! All of them were melted and stuck to other cookies, etc., it was a mess. I shudder to think of what these cookies would look like if it were the usual temperature around here.As far as how these cookies taste, yes they are yummy. They are also very messy, even if they weren't all melted and re-solidified.  I am not a huge fan of Black Oreo crumbs all over my flooring.  I felt like I had eaten something similar to it before, but still can't quite put my finger on it. These things are way too easy to eat, kinda like Girl Scout Thin Mints. Before you know it, half the package will be gone. Definitely not good at this time of year if you are trying to figure out how to shed some of those extra winter pounds.I stopped by Walmart today and saw these very cookies on the shelf there for under $3. My advice has to be to get them at a brick & mortar store if you want your cookies to be in any kind of condition to eat.
summary: Tasty, but probably not something to order via Amazon

reviewText: This is a snack that should have been tasty - dried apples, apple juice, cinnamon.  I dehydrate apples and other fruits at home, and we love them as snacks, so I thought these would be similar.However, these apple snacks are rock hard and don't have a real apple taste.  Like several other reviewers noted, they tasted old and stale.  I like that they are organic, but I wouldn't buy them based on the flavor.

I really like this stuff.  I've used this for dipping and for sandwiches and Both are great.  The taste is a little hard to describe.  The raspberries are present just enough to be a little sweet.  There is actually a very noticable taste of jalapeno peppers. It is not hot, I don't think anyone would describe this a hot; however, you definately can pick up the japapeno pepper, which I really like.  If you've ever used jalanpenos in something that you baked first, then you will know what I mean.  the pepper retains falvor, but not its hottness.  Sweetness from raspberries and the flavor from the jalapenos blend really well (really they do) and offer a nice balance.I wouldn't dip chip in this, but pepperidge farms stlyed sliced sausage is great with it. Maybe cheese too.Reviewing food is not my thing, but I've done what I can.  Hope this helps.

Bob's Red Mill Light Spelt Flour UNBL White, 22-Ounce Packages (Pack of 4)This brand of spelt flour is magnificent; it's light, grand texture and very good.  It's easy to cook with; and have had no problems at all...just delight.
summary: Flour for taste as well as health
