reviewText: I have 2 boys, 5 and 8 and they love Happy Melts! They have been on a kick with Banana Mango but love all the flavors. My 5 year old was asked to bring the snack to school last week and we brought these to share. All 13 of the kids in the class loved them and asked for seconds. My 8 year old is an extremely picky eater and he loves these as well.My favorite thing about them is that they contain probiotics (helps maintain a healthy balance of good bacteria in the intestines and boost your immune system) and prebiotics (which keeps the good bacteria healthy). I have checked other brands and Happy Melts is the only product to have both of these. I also love that it comes in BPA packaging and does not contain anything artificial. I wish I could give this product 10 stars!!!

Chocolates like Scharffen Berger converted me from a milk-chocolate only fan to a "it's not real chocolate unless it's dark" kind of gal. This particular product definitely holds up that opinion.I could taste the fruity flavors boasted by this chocolate's description. They almost seemed to follow one after the other, providing a multiplicity of flavor sensations in a single bite. On the one hand, that's a delightful way to eat chocolate. On the other hand, though, the flavors parade through so quickly that it can be difficult to truly enjoy each one. Meanwhile, there is one flavor that pops up toward the end that simply is not as pleasant as those that precede it. It wasn't a bad taste - somewhat prune-like, but not in a bad way - but it just wasn't what I wanted at the end of a much more delicious chocolate experience.If you like fruity chocolate and are willing to spend the money, this is worth the tasting. If you do not like fruity flavors in your chocolate, however, I would recommend avoiding this particular treat.
Tastes just like the original Hellmann's mayonnaise but without the saturated fat. An easy change to improve to a healthier diet.
V-8 really gives both myself and my husband the pick-me-up that we need. This form makes it handy so that we are more likely to use it. It is a good buy and all merchant expectations were met.
This is a good healthy snack of organic dried apples. As apples go, I prefer a peeled fresh apple, but this is good for a snack that's ready to go. Convenient and healthy!

Go Energy's GoPicnic boxes offer a handy and healthy alternative to meat-cheese-cracker snack packs that are commercially available. Not only would the vegetarian snack box work for picnics or those on-the-go, but it could also work as a light school or work lunch.Our snack pack included a package of four thin flax and honey crackers, a package of Wild Garden's creamy garbanzo bean hummus dip, dry roasted edamame, a small package of dried cranberries and pineapple, an Almond Roca toffee candy for dessert, and a moist towelette.The serving size, especially the dried fruit, was rather small.Taste-wise, the snacks had good flavor.Health-wise, the snacks were well chosen. They include no trans fat, no high fructose corn syrup, and no MSG. GoPicnic has meals to fit all dietary requirements, including gluten-free, vegetarian, kosher, and halal.The included foods are minimally processed and require no refrigeration or cooking. They truly can be taken and enjoyed anywhere - picnics, work breaks, field trips, afternoon snacks, or lunch.

So I have had several flavors of these breakfast cookies and have to say this is one of my least favorite flavors. I think the flavors that are built on oatmeal are better because they taste like they should, like the oatmeal chocolate chunk with raisins are better than these because they taste like an awesome oatmeal cookie with add-ins and not like a oatmeal cookie trying to taste like a peanut butter cookie. The chocolate chocolate chunk ones are three stars too for the same reason. The oatmeal flavors are all 5 stars!
summary: These are ok, other flavors better IMHO

reviewText: These cookies remind me more of shortbread than graham crackers with a light chocolate coating on one side.  I can taste a slight graham cracker taste but to me these taste more like shortbread.  They are crunchy and not to sweet.  They are good but it's easy to overindulge if you're not careful.  Each container has 2.5 servings at 140 calories per serving = 350 calories if you finish off the container.The containers are easy to open, the lid is loose after closing the container but it stays on, they fit in the drink holders in my vehicle and are easy to toss and carry in my purse.  For those who care about their environmental footprint:  The container itself is made of #4-lid and # 5-container plastic.  Recycling for these plastics are not available locally and I really hate to dispose of these containers in the trash. I still prefer purchasing in bulk and using reusable containers.If you stick with one serving (17 bite sized crackers about 1" x 1/2" in size) these are quite tasty and eases cravings for something sweet without being too sweet or too high in calories.
Great coffee great price nice flavor great value will buy again works well in kerig machines no leakage no grounds in coffee

Four stars for the cider, zero for the price. They go for 6.95 for 12 at my local supermarket. .57 each. The prices of this product on Amazon are all over the ballpark.If your local market has a selection of K-Cups, they may also have the Green Mountain Apple Cider. If not, ask them to order it and they probably will. This stuff is good, but not at over a dollar per cup.
I this tea is ok, the lavender is different so I just put some honey in it and it is ok from there.

I'm assuming if you're reading this review that you realize that it's instant coffee, and you know what that means (easy to prepare; often weak; lacks the bold flavor of real coffee). Some of us, like me, prefer the ease and variability of instant coffee - I can make it as strong or as weak as I like! The mint chocolate does a good job of masking the fact that this is instant coffee. My one potentially negative comment would be that the mint is very, hm, fresh (almost bordering on toothpaste) and is the strongest of the flavors.
summary: Very minty. Very sweet. Nice chocolate flavor.

reviewText: Okay, we were so excited to try this cereal. We had just ordered koala crunch, and the kidswere just okay with it, but not very impressed. This really hit the spot. We added a it more cinnamon to the cereal, and that seemed perfect to us.
summary: Very good, and passed the kid test!

reviewText: Keebler Mini Cookies combine shortbread cookies with stripes of fudge which is made with 100% real cocoa. The cup is three ounces and has approximately 35 cookies. Each serving (14 cookies) has 200 calories.Every so often I want a little something to snack on and Keebler Mini Cookies are perfect when I do need a snack. Mini is the right word - these are tiny cookies, maybe the size of a nickel, but they are very tasty. The cup is a nice size - it could easily fit in a cup holder in a car for kids to snack on during long car trips or even for an adult driving to and from work or errands. The lid is also nice - while it doesn't seem all that sturdy at first glance, it is and keeps the cookies nice and fresh. Of course, these cookies are so good they won't last long enough to have a chance of becoming stale!I really like Keebler Mini Cookies.
Product was received fresh and meets my needs for a healthy omega 3 supplement to my diet.  Will purchase again.

Wow! I had forgotten how much I used to like these, and I still do, maybe there are only 3 flavors (I am old enough that I can't remember how many flavors these used to come in) but they still taste great, just sour and sweet enough, then when you least expect it, that fizz from the powder inside. My kids got a kick out of these, I guess they thought it was kinda cool to taste the kind of candy that ol momm used to eat when she was a kid.
Tim Horton's coffee is by far the best coffee I've had.  So much better than Dunkin' and Starbucks.  It has a nice rich flavor without being bitter.

I use three cups of bread flour1 cup of this spelt flourand make terrific no knead bread. Add a little vital wheat gluten for lift if you are not sensitive and a little rye flour to help jazz your yeast -- especially if you are working with sour dough.the result is terrific.Update 12/10/11Still love the flour. Rethinking my subscription with Amazon as the last batch came poorly packed, with two of four bags torn. it was a mess.
summary: fabulous and yummy. Great in no-knead bread

reviewText: I don't generally buy fat-free products because they usually taste like crap.  These brownies are surprising good for a fat-free brownie.  However, they are a little too sweet (and this is coming from someone who has a major sweet tooth). Also, when you first eat one of these, they seem to taste really great, so maybe you'll have another . . . and another.  But by the time you start the third one, you'll notice a slight aftertaste of some kind, like it's missing something important (and it is:  fat).  So, these aren't bad to ride out a sweet craving, but they're definitely not as delicious as "real" homemade brownies.

I had high hopes because I like Ginger and Lemon.  Not always happy with the way that honey tastes when it is previously added to drink mixes.Having said that, I have no idea what it is about the mixture but it smells a little bit like brewer's yeast to me both before I added water and after.I did my level best to drink the cup of Gold Kili and the best I could do was four or five sips.The ginger and lemon do not come through in a significant way.  The drink is overly sweet.  And, as mentioned... it smells different than you might expect and to me was not pleasant.

I absolutely love Quaker's Real Medleys Apple Walnut Oatmeal!  I received one bowl as part of the Vine review program; however, I have purchased the various flavors every week since.  The apple walnut is my favorite flavor of the varieties offered.  The bowl size is fulfilling enough to keep you satisfied all morning, yet it is lean enough for those who, like me, try to watch their calorie and fat intake.  Unlike other oatmeals, this one contains a generous amount of apples and walnuts. What I like most about this oatmeal is its convenience.  There is no need to boil water and mix it with a packet of oatmeal; you simply add water to the fill line in the bowl and microwave.  In less than one minute, a hearty breakfast is ready!
I was disappointed in these cookies, the taste was off, and they crumbled to easily, most of the M&M;'s were offI think the elves need to improve this cookie.

The package is terrible! My bag was split open and green tea powder was spilled everywhere! I lost 4-6 cups worth. It was a pain cleaning up that tea powder. I had to put it in my own plastic container. For $80/lb I expect better. Will never order this brand again! Not worth the trouble. It also took over a week to arrive, when I paid for regular shipping.I tried this plain, with only water, and it was smooth enough to drink. Normally I drink it in lattes. With Culinary Teas brand, I had to add vanilla and sugar to the latte to make it palatable. Even though this costs more than Culinary Teas, it is worth it. I still add a bit of sugar to the latte though. The packaging is terrible, some form of hippie foil bag inside a cardboard box. Every time you spoon out some tea, it spills and powder gets everywhere. The inner bag is not resealable neither. I wish they came in larger sizes, with a resealable container.
summary: Good flavor, poor packaging, will never order again

reviewText: this is the real thing. Better than European products that as soy or other oils. This is very good. Cooking, salads, is very good. i like this much better than the Greek brand I was buying in the past. Like keeping the money here in this country. Bottled in California. Most likely some Mexican olives in it but it is real and nothing added. Shipping is fairly fast. Well packaged. I will continue to buy this brand.

I love this flour for making cakes or baked goods.  It is very finely ground which takes away from that gritty taste you get with most rice flours.  Many company's claim to have finely ground rice flour but this is the only one I have found that is truly ground to a fine level.  I don't use this flour for bread because the recipe that I have makes a good bread without this particular flour and this one is rather expensive so I only use it for finer baked goods.

These noodles are the 2nd best spicy noodles. The best, is the black premium version Nongshim makes. It's definitely worth buying this by the cases, since you'll eventually finish them anyway and these are so much better than Maruchan.
Sourwood is my fav honey but this is a very close 2nd.  Good price too!

The Raw or turbinado cane sugar is just as good as the german rock sugar, only thing it is not as presentable. It comes in packets that are only 20 calories per packet. Just eye ball the amount of sugar in packet compared to amount of german you use.  All there is to it.  Tastes as good as the german at least for my tastes and the price is way less.

i love nature path products. and i respect dr. weil. so when i saw both of them working together i had to try the bar. and i was very pleased.great flavor, great consistency, fresh taste, healthy ingredients, easy to eat.the best part is that it is organic and gluten free.i have tried the other flavor, goji moji, which i loved, but it has cashews in it, for those that are trying to avoid cashews. the banana manna don't have cashews.

The first sip gave a pleasing flavor burst with a light tang of carbonation.  When testing the black cherry flavor, I had placed the can in the freezer for a short period, since I prefer drinks to be ice cold or hot; I didn't want lukewarm to get in the way of a positive response to the first sip.  As the drink warmed a bit, the sweetness overtook the carbonation, which is inevitable in a carbonated beverage, yet, due to the purity of the fruit base, the flavor remained true and welcome.When trying the kiwi flavor, I just had the drink chilled perfectly for me, no ice crystals.  I like the kiwi even better than the cherry!  The kiwi has more tang.  See below (or on the product description on the buying page) for the juice blends used.  I've noticed that most juices currently have apple and grape included, likely because those are cheaper to produce.The way the drink was promoted wasn't a lie!  It worked for me:1. "100 % of what you want.  0% of what you don't want."2. "Make The Switch to a great tasting, all natural beverage that's the perfect balance between JUICE and CARBONATION."3. The logo has "THE" placed upside-down and reversed, atop "Switch," with a swirl designed around the words, the swirl imitating the symbol for reversing something.4. The ingredients read: "100% juice (filtered sparkling water sufficient to reconstitute juice concentrates, apple, grape, kiwi, acerola* [I added the asterisk; see below] and raspberry and strawberry juice concentrated), natural flavors, ascorbic acid (vitamin C)"5. 100% juice carbonated.6. The can is smaller than the norm for soda pops, which I also liked, because when I used to drink sodas regularly, I usually opened a can and left half of it to get too warm (and fizzed out), so the remainder went down the drain (after I returned it to the fridge for a few days hoping I might drink it).  I drank the whole can of Black Cherry!I decided I liked the near slush state of a short stint in the freezer... leaving it too long, though, might cause too much separation of the fruit concentrate from the fizz water... and, of course, makes it undrinkable from the can until it melts enough to flow through the hole in the top.In the past, when I had begun wanting something more natural than most soda beverages (with phosphates, etc., added), I had used frozen orange juice concentrate added to Club Soda or Ginger ale.  It didn't take long to feel that the process was too much trouble (and it was more expensive than the cost of the Switch product).  Also, I like the types of fruits Switch is using.At first I was confused at the acerola* ingredient, not knowing what it was.  Since myKindle 2: Amazon's New Wireless Reading Device (Latest Generation)was at hand, as always, I looked up acerola in the onboard dictionary.  The word wasn't in there, so I pushed the curser to the right, on the arrow for more types of searches, and used my standby, Google, and found several listings of acerola.Briefly, I found that it's thought to have originated from the Yucatan, and is known as Barbados cherry or wild crape myrtle, a tropical fruit-bearing shrub.  Reading into the variety of praiseworthy qualities of that cherry, I was impressed!  It has 32 times the amount of vitamin C as Orange juice, and many other healthful assets.  If you're interested in details, feel free to go Google.I'm beginning to think that many of the flavors available from Switch will include equally intriguing tropical fruits.  (I was glad to see that other flavors also have acerola in them).Though the can is appealing and fine, this beverage is good enough to deserve a designer bottle to appeal to the gourmet crowd who want flavor without true health issues... don't get me started on the myriad of heavy promotions of pseudo health issues.  I have a book in progress to be published on KINDLE, which will debut with steam hissing out of Kindle's ears, at no extra charge!  (I'll add a comment to this review about why I had quit drinking soda pops, which will explain why I will be happily able to welcome Switch into my diet.)My thanks to THE SWITCH for providing a healthy, gourmet quality drink... WITHOUT, thank God, SOYBEANS added!!I'm hooked!Linda ShelnuttAuthor of several Kindle books and Amazon ShortsP.S.With chagrin and apologies I've had to add comment updates here
summary: A Wish for Guilt Free Flavor

reviewText: I bought it because it was cheap and this coffee has no taste or flavor.  It tastes like bad diner coffee.  Will not buy again.
This bread is not bad and does not have as many cal. as alot of GF stuff does. better if you toast it.

The 3 once paper cup sample arrived in an undamaged shipping container. But the cookie container itself was crushed as were some of the cookies. The container on the plus side does come with a snap on lid. Normally I love these cookies but in the case I liked them. The were work too eat. Because of the time of year, with warm weather  the thin coat of fudge frosting on the bottom of each tiny cookie was partially melted. Fudge was stuck over the cup's interior and the inside of the disposable lid. This not only placed most of the fudge on the plastic container, what remained on the cookies just fused them together into a messy ball of cookies. Good note: the cookies were fresh. So order in winter or buy locally.
summary: Good cookie, wrong time of year

reviewText: I really enjoyed these bars. They were not as well received by my family as the muesli Oskri bars, but, I really liked them. Although they are a little on the sweet side, they taste great and they are a great snack between meals. The bars are really natural tasting, therefore, they have a very nutty taste, which some may find bland. These are no frill bars that taste great without all of the additional artificial flavorings and added unnecessary sugar laden components.
summary: Oskri Turkish Delight Bars, Quite Tasty

reviewText: Like many I have a problem not finishing a regular 12oz can or 16oz bottle of Coke. These new mini-cans are the perfect size to have a glass of Coke with your sandwich or late night snack. Same great taste, just less of it.
summary: Classic Coke taste in a more convenient size.

reviewText: When my son was diagnosed with peanut allergy I thought my life was over.  I practically lived on peanut butter and jelly sandwiches! But thanks to Sunbutter I can eat pseudo pbj sandwiches and pretend its peanut butter. Yay! Plus this makes really good peanut-free no-bake cookies! Just be advised that the organic Sunbutter is closer to creamy peanut butter, so sometimes we live on the edge and buy the "crunchy" Sunbutter even though its not organic.
summary: Great for those with peanut allergy.

reviewText: This is a delicious herb tea, with a mild yet distinct blueberry flavor, just right for iced tea.
I like all the flavors and the ginger helps control aches and pains.  The wrappers are the only downside.  They are too hard to take off.

This is handy to have around and it is very good in cereal or coffee.  I wanted to leave a comment though that in my opinion it is not good for use in a Aeroccino Milk Frother.  For some reason this did not froth or warm well like regular whole milk does.  If you getting it for coffee or cereal - go for it - it is fine for those items, but if you plan on heating/warming it I would recommend the whole milk from your grocery store.

This seal salt it is indeed a salt of all trades. Whatever you need salt for, odds are this salt can provide you with some assistance. With nutrition of theSayulita Sea Salt - Organic Coarse - 16 oz - by RealGoodSaltand the flavor every great salt, this celtic sea salt is a must own. You will indeed find variety in this salt.

Same quality Apple Cider Vinegar other companies sell but at a price that can't be beat! Plus fast shipping. Second time I've used The Vitamin Shoppe for this product and if their prices stay this good I'll continue doing business with them."

Lipton's Herbal Pyramid Tea is a quality product. It is made with real pieces of hibiscus and blackberry, giving it an authentic flavor. It is also caffeine free, making it a good tea to drink before bed. The tea is also calorie free, making it a good choice for those trying to lose weight. The tea is somewhat strong, so do not let it steep for too long. The diamond shaped tea bags are unique and allows more room for fruit and herbs to infuse.

I noticed this particular ingredient in the back of this product when I was going to purchase it at Costco: "Carrageenan"I remember reading something negative about it so I Google it and I found a number of studies describing its toxicity and negative side effects.In summary: Promotes tumors, intestinal ulcerations and neoplasms and inflammatory bowel disease.45 publicly funded studies conclude that "the potential role of carrageenan in the development of gastrointestinal malignancy and inflammatory bowel disease requires careful reconsideration of the advisability of its continued use as a food additive".Please read it yourself, the NIH has listed several of these studies. This is one:==========================================================Review of Harmful Gastrointestinal Effects of Carrageenan in Animal ExperimentsJoanne K. TobacmanCollege of Medicine, University of Iowa, Iowa City, Iowa, USAIn this article I review the association between exposure to carrageenan and the occurrence of colonic ulcerations and gastrointestinal neoplasms in animal models.Although the International Agency for Research on Cancer in 1982 identified sufficient evidence for the carcinogenicity of degraded carrageenan in animals to regard it as posing a carcinogenic risk to humans, carrageenan is still used widely as a thickener, stabilizer, and texturizer in a variety of processed foods prevalent in the Western diet.I reviewed experimental data pertaining to carrageenan's effects with particular attention to the occurrence of ulcerations and neoplasms in association with exposure to carrageenan. In addition, I reviewed from established sources mechanisms for production of degraded carrageenan from undegraded or native carrageenan and data with regard to carrageenan intake.Review of these data demonstrated that exposure to undegraded as well as to degraded carrageenan was associated with the occurrence of intestinal ulcerations and neoplasms. This association may be attributed to contamination of undegraded carrageenan by components of low molecular weight, spontaneous metabolism of undegraded carrageenan by acid hydrolysis under conditions of normal digestion, or the interactions with intestinal bacteria.Although in 1972, the U.S. Food and Drug Administration considered restricting dietary carrageenan to an average molecular weight > 100,000, this resolution did not prevail, and no subsequent regulation has restricted use. Because of the acknowledged carcinogenic properties of degraded carrageenan in animal models and the cancer-promoting effects of undegraded carrageenan in experimental models, the widespread use of carrageenan in the Western diet should be reconsidered.Environ Health Perspect 109:983-994 (2001).==========================================================I contacted the vendor to inquire of this, below is their answer:==============================================Discussion Thread---------------------------------------------------------------Response Via Email (Nancy Bruland) - 10/02/2013 04:55 PMDear Al,Thank you for contacting Organic Valley.For quite some time we've been actively seeking to reformulate our cream, chocolate milk, eggnog and soy milks in order to eliminate the need for carrageenan. Our award-winning eggnog, for example, was carrageenan-free in time for the 2012 holiday season!  And as of September 2013, our half gallon and quart chocolate milk is also carrageenan-free, as well as our soy milk milk is not far behind (October, 2013) !  Please note that our traditionally pasteurized heavy whipping cream has always been produced without carrageenan.  We're working hard so that the small number of other products in our line that use carrageenan won't be far behind. [...]We want to let you know that we're working very hard on the reformulation process and that we've engaged this effort not only because consumers want simpler foods with less ingredients, but because it fits with our overall philosophy of producing food the most wholesome way possible.Thank you again for your comments. Please be assured that we hear you and hope to give you what you desire very soon!Sincerely,The Consumer Relations TeamCROPP CooperativeOrganic Valley/Organic Prairie Brands1-888-444-6455==============================================So I think there is hope and eventually this product will reach the quality level that organic consumers are expecting, however and until that happens, evidence tells us that the toxicity levels created by carrageenan make it extremely dangerous for consumption and in my opinion, irrational even thinking about giving it to your children.
summary: Contains Carrageenan which promotes tumors in the body

reviewText: This is my husband's favorite pasta, whole wheat thin spaghetti. It tastes great, tender and chewy. It is also easy to cook. It only takes about 10 minutes depending on the quantity. This is his favorite brand.I like it because he is getting more nutrition with the whole wheat kind.I highly recommend it.

This latest addition to the Knorr product line of pasta sides is another fine addition to a very tasty line.While preparing a couple steaks , we thought this would make the perfect side dish , and it did.The bacon - parmesan flavoring provided the perfect balance to our meat selection , and the red wine added to the meal made it even better.The package contains the perfect serving sizes with a little left over to enjoy later.

I have been drinking Iron Goddess of Mercy for years. Perhaps I can't get over how cool a name this tea has :)! However, I only would try Rishi brand and in a bind, I ended up buying Numi, and I love it. There is a slight difference in aroma and after taste between the 2 brands, and while I really still love Rishi, I love this one almost just as much and with some raw honey, it is a delicious drink to keep you going all day !!!

McLib's Southern Dumplings looked really good but when I opened the plastic sealed packages, they were infested with flour weevils. Needless to say, they went straight into the trash. I was very disappointed I never got to try them in chicken and dumplings. I don't think I will be ordering them again.
summary: The dumplings looked good but had to throw they away

reviewText: I like gummy bears. I have bought store brands, but they don't come close to Haribo gummy bears. I like them so much I put them on my continuous order!

love that they're gluten free so my daughter can eat them too.  nice apple taste without being too sweet.  Not too big of a bar so it's not overly filling, just right when you need SOMETHING and good to know it's healthy!
summary: saw these on the biggest loser

reviewText: Update 4/27/2013 - After my initial review, the company contacted me.  They asked a lot of questions, and listened to what I had to say.  Then, they sent me another box of coffee to try.  This second batch was worlds better than the first, I have used about 10 of the cups, without one grounds explosion!!  The coffee always tasted good, but it is much better now without the grounds floating around!!  Excellent customer service after my initial review!  Good cup of coffee!  Thanks!~~~~~~~~~12/1/2012 - These took a long time to get here, because they were back ordered.  Not the fault of the supplier.  However, as many reviewers stated, the quality of the cups is not good.  Nearly every cup I get grounds in my coffee.  This should not happen, and with these cups it does.  I won't be re-ordering.
summary: Caza single serve cups - got a good batch of coffee!

reviewText: Good enough for pre-popped I guess. Maybe I was expecting too much, but I miss that "fresh popped" taste. The "lite" moniker should not scare away those that like buttery flavor, though-- this popcorn is actually rather buttered/salted by my standards. Nice that it's organic (must for us), but as mentioned, nothing beats popping your own, though it's nice to not have to deal with the unpopped kernels (I have yet to find any kernels in the 3 bags we've eaten thus far).

How can water be smart?  I don't know, but I do know it is great tasting water.  The water is distilled, but has electrolytes added to make it taste good - it reminds me of the taste of cold stream water in the mountains of Colorado that I used to drink as a kid (that was before giardia, etc. was in the water!)The size of the bottle is nice, too. It is slim and easy to hold, and easy to carry.  The bottles are made with some recycled material and they are completely recyclable.

we stopped buying bread at the store.  these hodgson mill breads are delicious andwork great in our breadman.  I have added mrs dash salt free herb mixes to some loaves andthe bread is so good.  the smell of the bread baking in the house is fabulous. try some.

This mix upholds the high standard of Pamela's Products.  It makes the best coffee cake I've ever had, a lovely, flaky biscuit, and wonderful cookies.  The flavor is light and not too sweet--perfect for sweeter pastry uses.  The mix produces a soft, tender textured good.  It has an almond base, something to be aware of for those allergic.  I will keep this mix in my GF pantry, indeed.  Best of all, I have no gluten reactions to it.

This is the best coffee for the price...and to have it Subscribe and Save available is the 'cream in my coffee'! (though for Sub&Save; you have to chase a distributor, as after first del'y, rec'd notice not avail so another search led to another seller.)If price matters, Walmart sells for less, unless you can get Subscribe and Save.Coffee is one of those items I track prices...like some people track fuel costs.

I'm not sure what variety other reviewers are referring to, but this particular product -- and I've double-checked -- is sweetened with sugar. It's a wonderfully rich, chocolatey flavor that isn't the least bit bitter. Every bit as good as the standard packets you add boiling water to. It's possible that this brand has a the same flavor-option that IS artificially sweetened, but this one has sugar as the first ingredient and tastes like it. It's a winner!

I picked up this coffee for my husband because we recently was given a Keurig coffee maker.  I walked into the house this evening and he started raving about this coffee.  I was told that it is full bodied yet very smooth.  There is a slight astringency that adds a kick to the coffee.They aren't actually in cups but rather little bags with a hard top.  And it comes in 3 bags of 12 rather then in a box.  I can appreciate this fact especially since the savings is passed on to me the customer.  Now if only they would also make an iced tea.

Very good tasting animal crackers.  Not super crunchy ones, if that's what you prefer, but just a little bit soft like the actual animal crackers that come in the little circus box.  Big bags too.  Very good price for what you get.
This is one of my favorite soups. It is tasty and nutritious . It also is low on sodium and  is a healthy choice for a soup.

I love Propel.  I tend to dehydrate easily, so this product prevents me from becoming sick or hospitalized due to severe dehydration.A nurse actually recommended them to me the last time I was admitted.  Have not been to ER since - as I always keep these in my purse and have learned to recognize early warning signs of dehydration.  Price is great (and much cheaper than ER and IV's)!!Also great to pack in kids lunches for field trips!
summary: Great to bring while camping, biking or hiking

reviewText: Miracle Whip is still holding the crown in my house. I wanted a different taste but this won't de-throne the all time King in my fridge.

For a something a little different from the usual rice or pasta sides at dinner, SideMate's couscous flavors are a fun change of pace. The "Roasted Garlic and Broccoli" version is a light and subtle flavor, but it's filling and has a great texture.If you haven't made couscous before, be sure to follow the directions exactly - bring the water and oil to a boil, stir in the mix, and then remove from the heat and cover. Don't continue to boil or just lower the heat as the couscous will stick together or over cook. I also recommend using olive oil instead of butter, as it gives a better flavor.
summary: Fun change from the standard side options

reviewText: These taste good and are gluten-free -- what's not to love?  My teen can scarf them two at a time.

I really believe this product lives up to its manufacturer's claims: tasty, sweet, chocolaty, but sans all the extra fat and calories. The nuts were roasted with cocoa powder, which is indeed an excellent idea! In fact, I like the idea so much I'm planning to experiment with this method in my own cooking. The almonds are quite high-quality too, they are fresh and with no irregularities. I would heartily recommend these almonds to any almond-lovers.
summary: excellent taste without a whole lot of extra calories

reviewText: For years, I have enjoyed this (as well as some other) New England clam chowder. Tasty. Simple--just add a little milk and heat the product in a pot until it gets hot enough.I wish it had less sodium (a real negative). But, beyond that, really enjoyable and a pleasure to eat.This will stay on my shopping list for some time to come!
summary: For what it is, pretty good

reviewText: Normal granola bar-type snacks quash my hunger for half an hour or so, but then it gradually comes crawling back.  However, I found Planters Big Nut Bars to be far more filling (they're bigger, so they're more filling). Also, they have large chunks of almonds, peanuts, and cashews, which provide a nice crunch amid the chewy bar.  They're a bit sticky, but if you hold the wrapper while you eat them, you're set.  Recommended.

To call these bars pure food might sound funny; isn't everything we eat food? To me most 'food' available in stores should not be eaten; what is special about these bars is that they are mostly whole ingredients not chemical concoctions; pure food.I have many nut allergies and this particular bar has been made in a clean enough setting that I have not had any reactions and I have eaten many many bars, and many other brands of food have given me allergic reactions.I absolutely love these bars, they are my special treat.
This tastes great and I like that it's more natural than most other sodas available. Basically, it's a carbonated juice.  I generally prefer a larger 12 oz. size though.

Surprisingly I keep reordering...and it has nothing to do with dieting......it is just one of those cereals you don't get TIRED OF....right up there with the classic cereals that have been around since I was a kid 50 years ago. Makes the milk taste so good. The berries add a nice little sweetness, but you do have to make sure they get pushed down in the milk so they soften up.  I really don't care if they are in this box because the flakes are so deliciously crunchy and sweet.....but if you like them, then you'll be happy to know you don't have to look for them, they are plentiful. They even come in individual serving bowls....just search on Amazon if you like it portable.

Went to college in Lancaster, PA which gave me easy access to pretzel country. I had many different brands and varieties. The Olde Tyme variety from Snyder's are one of my favorites and you don't have to visit PA to enjoy them as they are carried in many large food stores as well as Amazon. They have just the right amount of salt, crunch and flavor for my taste buds.

The Planters big nut bars are ok. They aren't too sweet, and actually I would have liked them to be just a little sweeter. They were not as crunchy as I thought they would be for having nuts in them. It could use more nuts than what are in them. I thought they were a bit bland tasting myself, but then again, different people have different tastes. I had my husband and my 10 year old try them. My husband really liked them as he is a HUGE peanut eater. My 10 year old liked them, but said she would only want one once in a great while. I agree with my daughter in the fact I wouldn't want them too often either. So, while they may be good for a quick snack they probably would not be something I would buy very often. They would probably be good to pack for a camping trip for a special treat.

I recently tried this product for the first time, and I'm hooked.  It's so easy to make and so delicious.  I don't think I'll go to a restaurant to order thai curry again.  I can make curry with this that is just as good or better than curry I've had in a lot of restaurants.  And it's so cheap!  One jar of this can last you a long time.

Not as aromatic as I thought it would be.  The K cups Hawaii Roasters used to have were much more aromatic than this bag of beans.  All in all a fairly smooth cup of coffee.  I was disappointed with this bag of coffee given how much it cost.  Folgers Black Silk would beat it on price alone. My first impression, after grinding the beans fine, and making it in a drip coffeemaker, would be to not purchase this again.  I will try different grinds and see how that goes.  If it gets better I'll update my review.  I'll try Blue Horse Kona next. For over $30 this coffee should have been better.  You can find better blends at much lower cost.Update 1:  I tried a medium grind, rather than fine grind on this coffee.  The taste was more like hot water than anything else I might describe.Update 2:  Since trying this coffee, I have purchased Kroger brand Kona blend.  To me, these two taste very similar.  You can pay more than $30a bag for this or hit Kroger for the same taste and pay $6 per bag.  All in all, I become more disappointed with this Hawaii Roasterpurchase.
summary: Not quite as smooth as I hoped...but not bad.

reviewText: I like this sweet/tart jelly on its own or to use in cooking and baking, but it's almost impossible to find. I prefer red currant to black currant, but for some reason, black currant is what most stores carry. This order of six jars arrived intact.
I purchase K-cups from Amazon for my Mother and she wanted to try this brand.  She liked this, but I have to say that her favorite brand is Donut Shop Coffee!!!

Yes, my family, despite not being as numerous as the Duggers nor as prone to indulgence as some, still managed to finish off a jar of this stuff within 24 hours.To think, I was worried about ordering 6 at once (the expiry was set 21 months in the future, though the individual jars are best before 6 months after they are opened).The taste is heavy on the (good quality and nutty) peanut flavor, with the dark chocolate playing a present-but-secondary role.Things heard around my house in the 24 hours since first taste(s):"Mmmmm, okay, I'll have a second spoonful!""I know I have a toothache and it's made worse with sugar, but I'll live with the pain later. GIVE ME THE JAR!""Mama, I remembered to use the potty. May I have some chocolatepeanutbutter pweeeeeeeeeease?!""Mmmm, okay, I'll stop after spoonful number 5 I promise...""Mama! IWANTMOREPEANUTBUTTER!" [followed by a single tear and a sorrowful "pweeeeeeease?"]"Hmm, I think I'll have a chocolate pb sandwich for lunch...""Do we have bananas anywhere? I need to try this with bananas and whipped cream!""OMG TRY THIS WITH BANANAS AND WHIPPED CREAM!!""So how long until Subscribe & Save sends us more? It's easy to make that sooner, right?"I'm going to be getting a few other kinds from this company and giving out 3-packs for birthdays/Christmas. This will also be ever-present in our house from this point forward, though we are going to need to learn moderation in the face of temptation like we've never known. Yum!
summary: One jar, one family, one day.

reviewText: It's been a long time since I've purchased this sort of cookie, and I was surprised by how sweet they are.It's overpowering.  It doesn't even taste like chocolate.  I just get SWEET SWEET SWEET in my mouth, and there isn't any other data getting to my brain.  After I eat the cookie, the aftertaste is actually a bit noxious.I also requested a different flavor from this brand, and surprisingly, they taste great.  These simply don't.  I love chocolate chip cookies, but perhaps I'm spoiled because I bake a lot.  These are simply too processed and sweet for me.  And I'm no snob.  I love cheap junk food.They are chewy, and they are filled with some kind of super sweet frosting, but it's just too darn sweet.  Makes my teeth hurt just thinking about it.  Also, when I cleaned out my desk I discovered one of these cookies had fallen out of my lunch bag a few weeks before.  It probably spent five weeks in the open air, and yet it was identical to a fresh cookie from the original package.  No bugs had touched it.  It hadn't dried out.  Whatever they are using to preserve this product is potent.I realize prospective customers for this product are not looking for Martha Stewart's $100 chef inspired perfect cookie, but they probably want something that is reasonably wholesome and tastes less like chemicals and corn syrup.

I love popcorn and I also love cinnamon sugar, so this was a fantastic combination of flavors and textures for me. If you love caramel or kettle popcorn, you'll definitely love this sweet, crunchy popcorn too.

If you have a Keurig brewer you will probably want to try making hot chocolate as well as tea and coffee. These K-cups are convenient and the flavor is delicious. I didn't notice any strange taste just the hot chocolate was pretty sweet. If you are used to a darker hot chocolate flavor then these might be too mild for you. I thought it was fine.~The Rebecca Review

This cereal really tastes good. I make it in the microwave, first heating the fresh cold water to boiling, then adding the cereal, stirring and returning it to the microwave to finish cooking. I let it boil and bubble for a bit in the microwave, which is when the cooking really occurs. I often let it sit in the microwave for a few minutes after it stops, to set up. Years ago a ham radio guy asked me (over the air!) whether I knew how to make gourmet microwave hot cereal. I said no - wondering how you could make anything gourmet, especially cooked cereal, in the microwave - but that I didn't express out loud... so he explained to me the above method, with emphasis on heating the cold water before adding the cereal. And definitely not using hot tap water, as that has the O2 chased out of it, or some such. So I guess that must be it!I used to laboriously mix various cereal grains to achieve this kind of mix, but with this product it is all done for me. It's also good with raisins added.I'm delighted that Amazon is selling some of these healthy food items that are hard to find in parts of the country. The special offers bring the price within reason.
summary: Healthy, hearty and tasty...and how to cook it.

reviewText: I'll admit it. I'm a tea snob. Most of the tea sold in American supermarkets is just... junk. Floor sweepings, as my Indian friends would say. I buy almost all of my tea directly from China, and it's always loose leaves, not tea bags. But Constant Comment has a special place in my heart, and I go on binges where it is pretty much all I drink. The aroma is lovely, and the combination of orange rind and cardamom makes for an interesting and flavorful cup of tea. CC is probably floor sweepings, too. But it tastes great and is very comforting. I do love these large boxes of 40 tea bags (4 bags per foil pouch) that Amazon sells, as it is convenient and long-lasting. One note: it does seem to give me a bigger caffeine "jolt" than I would like, so I usually de-caf it by brewing it for one minute, pouring out the water and then brewing for 3 minutes in fresh water. Your mileage may vary regarding the caffeine.

I love to make pumpkin muffins and bread. I first ordered this product over a year ago when pumpkin was hard to find in the store. Although I like to use natural/organic products, pumpkin is not necessarily one of those things that you need to have organic (due to the thick rind). However, the price of this is impossible to pass up - with S&S;, the per can price is cheaper than the local store generic! I didn't think there was much of a difference in taste, until recently I made my muffins with another "name brand" pumpkin-my muffins were just OK, certainly not as yummy as usual. The pumpkin was the only difference. So here I am ordering more! Unless the price shoots up dramatically, I won't use anything else.I didn't realize the dented can thing was a widespread issue. If I remember correctly, I do think some of my cans in my first order were dented, but not badly enough to make them unusable (obviously - we've eaten them all with delicious results and no ill effects LOL!)UPDATE: This latest order arrived in perfect shape in a well reinforced box - no dents or dings anywhere!

this is very good popcorn.  I like it because it's non GMO corn.  There are some hulls in it.  Not as many as the supermarket brand of bagged popcorn.  This is definitely a better quality popcorn.  I would order it again.
This is one of the worst banana nut bars I've tried.  All spice is overpowering.  Gnu banana nut bread is MUCH better and has a lot more fiber.

These items are why cheaper at Trader Joe's with the same ingredients...  I have to go with the Trader Joe's product ($1.99) instead of the Tasty Bites offer from Amazon....Tasty Bites are good but is the price equal to other re-sellers?  NO...
summary: Good deal if making multiple purhase

reviewText: Grew up in a tropical country with a coconut tree on our property. This is not even close to the real thing.Pro: not the most horrible drink I've ever had.Cons: There are so many better-tasting brands out there, I really can't see a reason to buy this.Do yourself a favor. Skip this. Get Nirvana.

I have Been drinking Constant Comment  since 1960.  I love this tea and am sooo happy it is still available.  I can remember my first cup and am so happy it has not changed.  What has changed is that I can only drink decaff tea.  So, I can drink this Constant Comment decaff tea and still get to sleep.

These contain 100mg of caffiene per serving, which is actually more than that in Red Bull (80mg) and yet they do not pack as much punch. The effect felt is temporary. After about an hour or two, you feel nothing and need to drink a second one. The only redeeming feature is that it's made from all-natural, organic ingredients. So, if that's important to you, then this might be an acceptable option.
summary: Inspired a little but not impressed.

reviewText: This is billed as a blend of light and dark roasts, and in the end it produced a robust medium to dark flavor. As always, the coffeee taste is highly subjective; but as a fact, they did not skimp on the coffee grounds like so many other K cups which only fill the cup half way; the mesh cups are full and carry enough coffee to produce a robust tasting brew on the higher cup size settings. On the other hand the pricing seems to be firmly in the premium territory right up there with Barrista Prima K-Cups, and those are a hard act to follow. I would still chose he Barrista Prima over this, but that could very well be because I prefer dark robust blends - I will give Melitta's darker variants a try before I make the final call...
While I like that these cookies are made with less ingredients than most on the market, the flavor is merely OK. It's worth trying, just don't expect them to be bursting with flavor.

This product is advertised as an "all natural energy drink". The sample I tried was supposed to be "strawberry banana flavor with other natural flavors". The taste was not pleasant. The first two ingredients are listed as apple juice and lemon juice. Next are water and apple puree. Then finally, strawberry puree and banana puree are listed, followed by "natural flavor" (?), caffeine, extract of stevia, and carbonation. It didn't taste good, and it wasn't refreshing or energizing.

As a lover of caramel popcorn I looked forward to trying this product with the added "benefit" of chocolate.  I couldn't have been more disappointed.  The alleged caramel coating had no flavor- none at all.  The chocolate was only marginally better- if I really concentrated I could discern a mild chocolate taste, but none from the caramel.  On the positive side, the popcorn flavor came through loud and clear.  I did not snack well on this product!
What can you say about cinnamon ???  LOLIt's great on anything you put it on even as a secret ingredient for a meat dry rub, mixed with other spices of course, lol.

The more I used this coffee, the better I liked it. Like some of the other reviewers, I like a strong, robust coffee flavor. 100% Ethiopian has a more mellow, subtle flavor with hints of green tea or chickory. That being said,the more I used this coffee, the better I liked it. I brewed it with a lot of coffee grounds per cup to bring out the flavor and then its true richness came out.

I was disappointed with this candy. I didn't particularly like the milk chocolate, though it was soft and creamy. The peanut butter part was also creamy, like it was mixed with the same chocolate. The package arrived kind of squished, so I wouldn't order this way as a gift. Not a favorite of my 7 year old either. I will say that I didn't find them gritty or overly sweet.

This has a nice, mildly sweet lemonade taste with a very slight sweetener aftertaste, that reminded me of powdered lemonades like Crystal Light.  It's basically a healthier substitute for a cup of coffee - it has zero calories, about as much caffeine as a cup of coffee, and half the daily value of vitamin E, vitamin B6, and vitamin B12.  It also has citicoline, a natural ingredient that might (or might not) help brain activity.All in all, I liked it.  If you're looking for a zero calorie caffeine drink and are tired of coffee and Diet Coke, it's worth a try.

I originally ordered a case of 28oz (whole) tomatoes in Feb 2013, price was just $34. Not even 6 months later, the price is now $53. reviewText: Lots of people have already reviewed these variety packs, so I'll try to make this useful. The packaging is as others have described and you can see some user uploaded photos of the type of boxes they use. The ones I got actually have a large red ribbon design printed on them, so they could be given as gifts without even wrapping. The boxes have the individual wells for the cups, so that they are securely held in place. If you are ordering from Crazy Cups, this is what you will get. Any other seller, you are taking your chances.As for the coffee variety, I see that people have had different experiences over time. I ordered mine about a month ago, and all 70 cups were unique. There were flavored coffees, some iced coffees, a couple of ciders, mochas, and other specialty variations. The roasts range from mild to super bold. I think I may have gotten only one or two decaf cups, which is a shame because I like to drink coffee at night, too, and decaf just makes more sense to me. Thankfully there are a wealth of reviews for every brand you can buy here on Amazon and I had no problem figuring out which decaf to get!One thing to consider with a variety sampler like this is the fact that you will get mild, medium, and dark roasts, in cups that vary in content amount, which in a standard Keurig means that your brewed cup will vary in intensity because you cannot adjust the amount of water it brews per cup. If you have a multi-brew machine like theBUNN MCU Single Cup Multi-Use Breweryou do have the option of varying the amount of water that brews, from 4 to 14 oz. so you can still control how mild or how strong the resulting cup is.
summary: True Variety of Brands and Roasts

There are several brands of microwavable meals on the market - Dinty Moore, Campbell's, etc - which do not need to be refrigerated, and require you to do no more than unseal the container and microwave it, usually for about 90 seconds.  These Healthy Choice Fresh Mixers are a little more involved, requiring you to add water (which hardly seems an onerous task, but these days, who knows what's considered onerous?) and they take about 5 minutes to prepare.  For the slight extra inconvenience, you get fresher pasta, tasting more like 'proper' cooking.The water level line is not as clearly marked, and the sauce cover not as easily removable, as they could be.This particular variety is very tasty.  Packaged pasta sauces often have a harsh, chemical taste, but this one was nice enough.  It's hardly a hearty meal, but it's a good light snack.  If you take microwavable meals to work (or college, or wherever) every day, then you'll want some variety, so you should give this one a try.
summary: Proper pasta with a savory sauce
